critique: This document primarily deals with setting the pay scales for various government employees, including those in the Executive, Legislative, and Judicial branches, as well as members of the uniformed services. It doesn't directly address issues of immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. Therefore, many of the axes will be scored as neutral. The document does not seem to expand executive power, but rather implements existing laws regarding pay. It also doesn't obviously favor either state or federal control. There's a slight interventionist aspect to setting pay scales, but it's a standard government function.
